Everywhere I go, I’m surrounded by rivals."}]}
name: Courtier
description:
In your earlier days, you were a personage of some significance in a noble court or a bureaucratic organization. You might or might not come from an upper-class family; your talents, rather than the circumstances of your birth, could have secured you this position.

You might have been one of the many functionaries, attendants, and other hangers-on in Coruscant's upper echelons, or perhaps you traveled in Nar Shaddaa's baroque and sometimes cutthroat conglomeration of guilds, nobles, adventurers, and secret societies. You might have been one of the behind-the-scenes law-keepers or functionaries on Dromund Kaas, or you might have grown up on some other affluent planet.

Even if you are no longer a full-fledged member of the group that gave you your start in life, your relationships with your former fellows can be an advantage for you and your adventuring comrades. You might undertake missions with your new companions that further the interest of the organization that gave you your start in life. In any event, the abilities that you honed while serving as a courtier will stand you in good stead as an adventurer.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Deception, Insight, Performance, and Survival
equipmentMarkdown: A set of fine clothes and a pouch containing 150 cr
featureMarkdown: Your knowledge of how bureaucracies function lets you gain access to the records and inner workings of any noble court or government you encounter. You know who the movers and shakers are, whom to go to for the favors you seek, and what the current intrigues of interest in the group are.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: The noble court or bureaucratic organization where you got your start is directly or indirectly associated with your bond (which could pertain to certain individuals in the group, such as your sponsor or mentor). Your ideal might be concerned with the prevailing philosophy of your court or organization.

personalityTraits: {"diceType":8,"name":"Personality Trait","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I ask a lot of questions."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I eat like a pig and have bad manners."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I think anyone who’s nice to me is hiding Dark intent."},{"minValue":7,"maxValue":7,"result":"I don’t like to bathe."},{"minValue":8,"maxValue":8,"result":"I bluntly say what other people are hinting at or hiding."}]}
ideals: {"diceType":6,"name":"Ideal","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"**Respect**. All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Light)"},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"**Community**. We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)"},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"**Change**. The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things. (Chaotic)"},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"**Retribution**. The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Dark)"},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"**People**. I help the people who help me—that’s what keeps us alive. (Neutral)"},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"**Aspiration**. I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life. (Any)"}]}
bonds: {"diceType":6,"name":"Bond","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"My town or city is my home, and I’ll fight to defend it."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring what I was forced to endure."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I’m wanted for it."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"No one else should have to endure the hardships I’ve been through."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I’ll do just about anything for more of it."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I will never fully trust anyone other than myself."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I’d rather kill someone in their sleep then fight fair."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"It’s not stealing if I need it more than someone else."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve."}]}
name: Urchin
description: You grew up on the streets alone, orphaned, and poor. You had no one to watch over you or to provide for you, so you learned to provide for yourself. You fought fiercely over food and kept a constant watch out for other desperate souls who might steal from you. You slept on rooftops and in alleyways, exposed to the elements, and endured sickness without the advantage of medicine or a place to recuperate. You’ve survived despite all odds, and did so through cunning, strength, speed, or some combination of each.\n\nYou begin your adventuring career with enough money to live modestly but securely for at least ten days. How did you come by that money? What allowed you to break free of your desperate circumstances and embark on a better life?
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Deception, Insight, Sleight of Hand, and Stealth
equipmentMarkdown: A small knife, a map of the city you grew up in, a pet mouse, a token to remember your parents by, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 100 cr
featureMarkdown: You know the secret patterns and flows to cities and can find passages through the urban sprawl that others would miss. When you are not in combat, you (and companions you lead) can travel between any two locations in the city twice as fast as your speed would normally allow.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Urchins are shaped by lives of desperate poverty, for good and for ill. They tend to be driven either by a commitment to the people with whom they shared life on the street or by a burning desire to find a better life— and maybe get some payback on all the rich people who treated them badly.

personalityTraits: {"diceType":6,"name":"Personality Trait","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I have different assumptions from those around me concerning personal space, invading others' space in innocence, or reacting to invasion of my own."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I have my own ideas about food, and I find the eating habits of others fascinating, confusing, or revolting."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I have a strong code of honor or sense of propriety that others don't comprehend."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I express affection or contempt in ways that are unfamiliar to others."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I honor my deities through practices that are foreign to this land."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I begin or end my day with small traditional rituals that are unfamiliar to those around me."}]}

(Light)"},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"**Reserved.** As someone new to these strange lands, I am cautious and respectful in my dealings. (Lawful)"},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"**Adventure.** I'm far from home, and everything is strange and wonderful! (Chaotic)"},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"**Cunning.** Though I may not know their ways, neither do they know mine, which can be to my advantage. (Dark)"},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"**Inquisitive.** Everything is new, but I have a thirst to learn. (Neutral)"},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"**Suspicious.** I must be careful, for I have no way of telling friend from foe here. (Any)"}]}
bonds: {"diceType":6,"name":"Bond","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"So long as I have this token from my homeland, I can face any adversity in this strange land."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"The gods of my people are a comfort to me so far from home."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I hold no greater cause than my service to my people."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"My freedom is my most precious possession. I'll never let anyone take it from me again."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I'm fascinated by the beauty and wonder of this new land."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"Though I had no choice, I lament having to leave my loved one(s) behind. I ho pe to see them again one day."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I am secretly (or not so secretly) convinced of the superiority of my own culture over that of this foreign land."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I pretend not to understand the local language in order to avoid interactions I would rather not have."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I have a weakness for the new intoxicants and other pleasures of this land."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I don't take kindly to some of the actions and motivations of folk different from me."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I consider the adherents of other gods to be deluded innocents at best, or ignorant fools at worst."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I have a weakness for the exotic beauty of the people of these lands."}]}
name: Far Traveler
description:
Almost all of the common people and other folk that one might encounter throughout the galaxy have one thing in common: they live  their lives without traveling more than a few miles from where they were born.

You aren't one of those folk.

You are from a distant place, one so remote that few of the common folk realize that it exists, and chances are good that even if some people you meet have heard of your homeland, they know merely the name and perhaps a few outrageous stories.

Although you find some of this land's ways to be strange and discomfiting, you can also be sure that some things its people take for granted will be, to you, new wonders that you've never laid eyes on before. By the same token, you're a person of interest, for good or ill, to those around you almost anywhere you go.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Insight, Investigation, Perception, and Persuasion
toolProficiencyMarkdown: Any one musical instrument or gaming set of your choice, likely something native to your homeland
equipmentMarkdown: One set of traveler's clothes, any one musical instrument or gaming set you are proficient with, poorly wrought maps from your homeland, a small piece of jewelry worth 100 cr in the style of your homeland's craftsmanship, and a pouch containing 50 cr
specialityMarkdown: To determine why you are so far from home, roll on the table below or choose from the options provided.
featureMarkdown: Your foreign nature attracts attention, yielding access to people and places you might not otherwise have, for you and your traveling companions. Noble lords, scholars, and merchant princes, to name a few, might be interested in hearing about your distant homeland and people.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: The distance you've traveled manifests itself in the way you speak and carry yourself.

personalityTraits: {"diceType":8,"name":"Personality Traits","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I do not fear death, but accept it as part of life."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I have a crude sense of humor."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I find it good luck to have a flask of ale on me even when the most of my other belongings are gone."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I ask a lot of questions."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I never pass up a friendly wager."},{"minValue":7,"maxValue":7,"result":"I am always polite and respectful when speaking to those above my station."},{"minValue":8,"maxValue":8,"result":"I like a job well done, especially if I'm not the one doing it."},{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I'm always polite and respectful."}]}

(Lawful)"},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"**Live and Let Live.** You may not have a family left, but your enemy may. A little compassion goes a long way. (Light)"},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"**Measure of Last Resort.** Sometimes we have to do things that we REALLY don't want to do, but we must remember that we only do them because we have to. (Neutral)"},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"**Aspiration.** I have heard a tale of a legendary person of my class. I strive to be more like them. (Any)"}]}

I shall, until death, shape my life to what I want it to be."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"Without a purpose in the world, I find myself to be broken which I do not like."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I secretly pursue a love interest that is forbidden by a family whether it is my own or my love's family."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I am always looking for the bigger pay."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I can't tell a lie for the life of me."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I judge too easily by special appearance and pride."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I am almost always carrying some ale in with my gear."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I believe that I am the only skilled person of the group and am even open about it."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I will never let a comrade stand alone, even if it gets me killed."}]}
name: Mercenary
description: As a sell-sword who fought battles for coin, you're well acquainted with risking life and limb for a chance at a share of treasure. Now, you look forward to fighting foes and reaping even greater rewards as an adventurer. Your experience makes you familiar with the ins and outs of mercenary life, and you likely have harrowing stories of events on the battlefield. You might have served with a large outfit or a smaller band of sell-swords, maybe even more than one. \n\nNow you're looking for something else, perhaps greater reward for the risks you take, or the freedom to choose your own activities. For whatever reason, you're leaving behind the life of a soldier for hire, but your skills are undeniably suited for battle, so now you fight on in a different way.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Athletics, Investigation, Persuasion, and Piloting
equipmentMarkdown: A uniform of your company (traveler's clothes in quality), an insignia of your rank, a gaming set (one of your choice), and a pouch containing the remainder of your last wages (100 cr)
featureMarkdown: You know the mercenary life as only someone who has experienced it can. You are able to identify mercenary companies by their emblems, and you know a little about any such company, including the names and reputations of its commanders and leaders, and who has hired them recently. You can find the cantinas and feasthalls where mercenaries abide in any area, as long as you speak the language, and if you spend at least an hour in such a location you can come across one of the following bits of information: a job offer, significant rumor, referal to a skilled merchant, blacksmith, etc., or a hint towards the pursuit of your current quest. Additionally, you can find mercenary work between adventures sufficient to maintain a comfortable lifestyle (see "Practicing a Profession" under "Downtime Activities" in chapter 8 of the Player's Handbook).
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Mercenaries are shaped by their lively nature, for the better and the worse. They tend to be driven by either their commitment to money or something more valuable.

name: Guild Artisan
description: You are a member of an artisan’s guild, skilled in a particular field and closely associated with other artisans. You are a well-established part of the mercantile world, freed by talent and wealth from the constraints of a feudal social order. You learned your skills as an apprentice to a master artisan, under the sponsorship of your guild, until you became a master in your own right.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Athletics, Insight, Persuasion, and Technology
toolProficiencyMarkdown: One type of artisan’s tools, biochemist's kit, or chef's kit
equipmentMarkdown: A set of tools (one of your choice), a letter of introduction from your guild, a set of traveler’s clothes, and a belt pouch containing 150 cr
featureMarkdown: As an established and respected member of a guild, you can rely on certain benefits that membership provides. Your fellow guild members will provide you with lodging and food if necessary, and pay for your funeral if needed. In some cities and towns, a guildhall offers a central place to meet other members of your profession, which can be a good place to meet potential patrons, allies, or hirelings.\n\nGuilds often wield tremendous political power. If you are accused of a crime, your guild will support you if a good case can be made for your innocence or the crime is justifiable. You can also gain access to powerful political figures through the guild, if you are a member in good standing. You must pay dues of 50 cr per month to the guild. Your dues must be current to remain in the guild’s good graces.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Guild artisans are among the most ordinary people in the world—until they set down their tools and take up an adventuring career. They understand the value of hard work and the importance of community, but they’re vulnerable to sins of greed and covetousness.

I can’t get the images of violence out of my mind."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I’m full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I can stare down a hell hound without flinching."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I enjoy being strong and like breaking things."},{"minValue":7,"maxValue":7,"result":"I have a crude sense of humor."},{"minValue":8,"maxValue":8,"result":"I face problems head-on. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"My honor is my life."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I’ll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I made a terrible mistake in battle cost many lives— and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I obey the law, even if the law causes misery."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"I’d rather eat my armor than admit when I’m wrong."}]}
name: Soldier
description: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember. You trained as a youth, studied the use of weapons and armor, learned basic survival techniques, including how to stay alive on the battlefield. You might have been part of a standing national army, a mercenary company, or perhaps a member of a local militia who rose to prominence during a recent war.\n\nWhen you choose this background, work with your DM to determine which military organization you were a part of, how far through its ranks you progressed, and what kind of experiences you had during your military career. Was it a standing army, a town guard, a village militia, or perhaps a private company.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Athletics, Intimidation, Persuasion, and Piloting
equipmentMarkdown: An insignia of rank, a trophy taken from a fallen enemy, a gaming set (one of your choice), a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 100 cr
specialityMarkdown: During your time as a soldier, you had a specific role to play in your unit or army. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your role:
featureMarkdown: You have a military rank from your career as a soldier. Soldiers loyal to your former military organization still recognize your authority and influence, and they defer to you if they are of a lower rank. You can invoke your rank to exert influence over other soldiers and requisition simple equipment for temporary use. You can also usually gain access to friendly military encampments where your rank is recognized.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: The horrors of war combined with the rigid discipline of military service leave their mark on all soldiers, shaping their ideals, creating strong bonds, and often leaving them scarred and vulnerable to fear, shame, and hatred.

personalityTraits: {"diceType":8,"name":"Personality Trait","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I ignore the rhetoric a person spouts when meeting them, preferring to judge them by action."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I’m the first to swing a punch, but the last to draw a weapon."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"Danger is my middle name."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"Goodwill is in short supply in the galaxy, and I always try to foster a little more wherever I go."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"Both the Republic and the Empire have tried to crush us under their bootheels. I refuse to yield."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"Defiant to the last isn’t good enough. Upon death I will become a force spirit and continue to defy my killer."},{"minValue":7,"maxValue":7,"result":"Well-behaved people rarely make history."},{"minValue":8,"maxValue":8,"result":"What gave you the idea that I was going to give you a fair fight?"}]}
ideals: {"diceType":6,"name":"Ideal","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"**Respect.** Respect will be shown to everyone, disrespect will be shown to those who earn it. (Lawful)"},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"**Freedom.** People should be free to make their own way without interference. (Chaotic)"},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"**Growth.** Self-improvement is an unending chore, but one that must be done. (Any)"},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"**Escalation.** I will immediately end a hostile situation with all means at my disposal. (Neutral)"},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"**Power.** Given our luck with both Jedi and Sith, I need all I can get. (Dark)"},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"**Redemption.** There’s a spark of good in everyone. (Light)"}]}
bonds: {"diceType":6,"name":"Bond","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"The Jensaarai took me in when nobody else would. I back the order 100%."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I was once a Jedi, but grew disillusioned by their inactivity."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I lost my mentor in battle. I will honor their sacrifice by destroying their killer."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I was able to slough off Dark Side corruption, but I couldn’t avoid making amends."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"The powerful use their strength to raise people up, not keep them down."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I might be a little too enamored with force choking my enemies."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I am my own worst critic, in everything I do."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"My armor is precision crafted and has served me faithfully. I never give up a chance to prove how well."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I have a collection of lightsabers from fallen foes, and I love adding to it."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"The Jedi and Sith worship the Force as a religion. I do everything I can to remind them they’re just worshipping a hammer."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"The minute you tell me that someone should not be crossed, I’m already crossing them."}]}
name: Jensaarai
description: You are a Jensaarai, a Force user who has come to understand the failings of both Jedi inactivity and Sith malevolence. While they wield lightsabers, a true mark of skill among the Jensaarai is the crafting of their armor. Each suit is perfectly unique to the wearer, and is frequently (but not always) adorned and shaped to represent an animal that the Jensaarai finds kinship with, up to and potentially including additional mounted weapons or sensors to further emulate that creature.\n\nWhile the Jensaarai train in, and will use dark side powers when necessary, they seek to avoid true corruption. They are not evil, nor are they wholly good either. They are anti-heroes, and well-practiced in this craft. In addition, the Jensaarai train in more than the lightsaber, employing whatever tools are at hand to best fit the job.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Insight, Intimidation, Lore, and Perception
equipmentMarkdown: A set of common clothes including a robe, a sturdy knife, and a belt pouch containing 150 cr
featureMarkdown: Due to the corruption of the Jedi training done to the pre-Jensaarai, you have a unique insight into both the Light and Dark side of the Force, as well as its history, applications, and techniques in a scholarly manner.\n\nYou fully understand concepts, and can recall key information, The exception being if the research was hidden from the public and you have not had experience working with, in which you may only partially understand. You also recognize well-known Jedi Masters and Sith Lords by their works and marks.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Jensaarai are shaped by the unique capacity of their upbringing. Their study of the duality of the Force manifests in their mannerisms and ideals. Their bond might be their family or their armor. Their flaws might be some a hatred of the Jedi or Sith or a desire to become one or the other.

name: Investigator
description: Rarer than watch or patrol members are a community's investigators, who are responsible for solving crimes after the fact. Though such folk are seldom found in rural areas, nearly every settlement of decent size has at least one or two watch members who have the skill to investigate crime scenes and track down criminals.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Insight, Investigation, Perception, and Survival
equipmentMarkdown: A uniform in the style of your unit and indicative of your rank, a horn with which to summon help, a set of binders, and a pouch containing 100 cr
featureMarkdown: Your experience in enforcing the law, and dealing with lawbreakers, gives you a feel for local laws and criminals. You can easily find the local outpost of the watch or a similar organization, and just as easily pick out the dens of criminal activity in a community, although you're more likely to be welcome in the former locations rather than the latter.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Years of service in the City Watch have led to the rigid discipline most often seen in military service. Working with your comrades has created a strong family bond and pride in your community.

personalityTraits: {"diceType":8,"name":"Personality Trait","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I’m driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I once ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn to my clan of an approaching orc horde. I’d do it again if I had to."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. (Any)"}]}
bonds: {"diceType":6,"name":"Bond","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"My family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in my life, even when they are far from me."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I will bring terrible wrath down on the Darkdoers who destroyed my homeland."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"It is my duty to provide children to sustain my tribe."}]}
flaws: {"diceType":6,"name":"Flaw","values":[{"minValue":1,"maxValue":1,"result":"I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants."},{"minValue":2,"maxValue":2,"result":"There’s no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest."},{"minValue":3,"maxValue":3,"result":"I remember every insult I’ve received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who’s ever wronged me."},{"minValue":4,"maxValue":4,"result":"I am slow to trust members of other species, tribes, and societies."},{"minValue":5,"maxValue":5,"result":"Violence is my answer to almost any challenge."},{"minValue":6,"maxValue":6,"result":"Don’t expect me to save those who can’t save themselves. It is nature’s way that the strong thrive and the weak perish."}]}
name: Barbarian
description: Though you might have only recently arrived in civilized lands, you are no stranger to the values of cooperation and group effort when striving for supremacy. You learned these principles, and much more, as a member of your tribe.\n\nYour people have always tried to hold to the old ways. Tradition and taboo have kept your tribe strong while the kingdoms of others have collapsed into chaos and ruin. But for the last few generations, some bands among the tribes were tempted to settle, make peace, trade, and even to build towns. Perhaps this is why your tribe chose to raise up the totems among the people as living embodiments of his power. Perhaps they needed a reminder of who they were and from whence they came. The Chosen of your tribe led bands back to the old ways, and most of your people abandoned the soft ways of civilization.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Animal Handling, Athletics, Nature, and Survival
toolProficiencyMarkdown: One type of musical instrument or artisan's tools
equipmentMarkdown: A hunting trap, a totemic token or set of tattoos marking your loyalty to your tribe, a set of traveler's clothes, and a pouch containing 100 cr
featureMarkdown: You have an excellent knowledge of not only your tribe's territory, but also the terrain and natural resources of the rest of the worlds. You are familiar enough with any wilderness area that you find twice as much food and water as you normally would when you forage there.\n\nAdditionally, you can call upon the hospitality of other tribes in times of need.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Often considered rude and uncouth among civilized folk, barbarians have little respect for the niceties of life in the cities. The ties of tribe, clan, family, and the natural world of which they are a part are the most important bonds to most outlanders.

name: Clone Trooper
description: You are one of millions; genetically engineered, identical specimens designed to be the perfect soldier. Created from a template provided by the legendary bounty hunter Jango Fett, you represent the latest and greatest evolution in galactic warfare.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Athletics, Medicine, Perception, and Piloting
toolProficiencyMarkdown: Your choice of demolitions kit, security kit, or slicer's kit
equipmentMarkdown: Badge or emblem of your rank, your chosen tools, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 100 cr
specialityMarkdown: While most clones serve as simple soldier, there are many specialized units. Roll a d8 or choose from the options in the table below to determine your specialization:
featureMarkdown: You are a soldier of the Republic. Those loyal to the Republic will respect your status and defer to you if they don't outrank you. You can invoke your position to exert influence over other soldiers, requisition simple equipment, and gain access to military compounds affiliated with the Republic.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Clones are trained from birth to be the perfect soldier; over time, they also develop their own personalities. They are universally loyal to the Republic. While clones share genetic coding, no two are completely identical.

name: City Watch
description: You have served the community where you grew up, standing as its first line of defense against crime and wildlife. You aren't a soldier, directing your gaze outward at possible enemies. Instead, your service to your hometown was to help police its populace, protecting the citizenry from lawbreakers and malefactors of every stripe.\n\nEven if you're not city-born or city-bred, this background can describe your early years as a member of law enforcement. Most settlements of any size have their own law enforcement forces.
proficiencyMarkdown: Choose two from among Athletics, Insight, Investigation, and Perception
equipmentMarkdown: A uniform in the style of your unit and indicative of your rank, a horn with which to summon help, a set of binders, and a pouch containing 100 cr
featureMarkdown: Your experience in enforcing the law, and dealing with lawbreakers, gives you a feel for local laws and criminals. You can easily find the local outpost of the watch or a similar organization, and just as easily pick out the dens of criminal activity in a community, although you're more likely to be welcome in the former locations rather than the latter.
backgroundFeatMarkdown: As a further embodiment of the experience and training of your background, you can choose from the following feats:
suggestedCharacteristicsMarkdown: Years of service in the City Watch have led to the rigid discipline most often seen in military service. Working with your comrades has created a strong family bond and pride in your community.
